abstracts.cdata!:
The National Initiative for Human
            Development Support Project for Morocco will assist the
            Government in improving inclusiveness, accountability and
            transparency of decision making and implementation processes
            at the local level in order to enhance use of social and
            economic infrastructure and services by poor and vulnerable
            groups. The Mid Term Review (MTR) for the project was held
            in November 2008. At this time it was found that several
            indicators proved redundant and the progress they were meant
            to measure could be monitored with fewer indicators. In
            addition, the project's indicators in the results
            framework were not directly related to the project
            development objective (PDO) nor to the project's
            components, and some target values were unrealistic. A
            request to restructure the project was finally received from
            the Ministry of the Economy and Finance on 25 December,
            2009. The long time that elapsed between the MTR and the
            formal request for restructuring is due to the consultations
            necessary among key stakeholders in Morocco as well as with
            other donors involved with the project. Given the high
            visibility of the project, it was also necessary to ensure
            that it was generally understood that the restructuring does
            not reflect problems with the project per se, but rather a
            need for more meaningful indicators to monitor the project.
